pli-tv-pvr15:8.8: Vaṇṇāvaṇṇo literally means “various colors” and vacanamanuppadānaṁ “providing speech”. The commentary, (), explains this as follows: Vaṇṇāvaṇṇoti nīlādivaṇṇāvaṇṇavasena sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ vuttaṃ. Vacanamanuppadānanti sañcarittaṃ vuttaṃ, “Vaṇṇāvaṇṇo is said on account of the various colors of blue, etc., in the training rule on emission of semen. Vacanamanuppadānan: matchmaking is meant.” In other words, this refers to the first and fifth offenses entailing suspension for monks.
